intro: Impatiens wibkeae, commonly known as Wibke's impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of western Uganda. It is a member of the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
